dct:description: A Devotee follows Sibyl Carruthers, a fragile young heiress whose passionate attachment to the much older Mr. Loftus leads to a controversial marriage. Misunderstanding, gossip and Sibyl's own sensitivity produce jealousy and illness that strain the household, while Mr. Loftus struggles with age, duty, and impending mortality. After a crisis in which he dies as Sibyl tends him, she spends a period of mourning and ultimately marries Doll, the steady cousin who had loved her. The novel examines affection, self-deception and the social pressures surrounding marriage and the declining country estate.
dcat:theme: Decline of the rural gentry / social change

mainCharacters.name: Sibyl Carruthers
mainCharacters.profile: A delicate, impulsive young heiress whose ardent, idealizing devotion drives the plot; emotionally fragile, she mistakes pity and protection for lack of love and suffers jealousy and illness as a result. Her choices — marriage to Mr. Loftus and later union with Doll after widowhood — expose themes of self-deception and social expectation.

mainCharacters.name: Mr. Loftus
mainCharacters.profile: An older, cultivated man of refined feeling and failing health who inspires deep devotion and respect; generous, conscientious and world-weary, he marries Sibyl despite the age gap and the burdens it brings. His sense of duty, tenderness, and ultimate death are central to the novel's tragedy and moral inquiry.

mainCharacters.name: Doll (Doll Loftus)
mainCharacters.profile: A steady, decorous young man of the county and relation/heir-figure whose unflashy reliability contrasts with Sibyl's romanticism; he loves Sibyl quietly and is wounded by jealousy but remains honorable. In the postscript he becomes Sibyl's second husband, representing conventional domestic stability.

mainCharacters.name: Lady Pierpoint
mainCharacters.profile: Sibyl's aunt and guardian, a socially-minded matron who orchestrates introductions and worries over the family's fortunes; warm, practical and sometimes wounded by Sibyl's neglect, she plays an important enabling and moderating role in Sibyl's life and social position.
